Description: Lower body sherd of East Greek black-figured pottery bowl; glaze fired red-brown; interior: glazed with added red band lined in white; exterior: dull pinkish cream slip; black-figure decoration consisting of rump, genitals, tail and hind legs of goat to left; snout and chest and front paw of lion also to left; rosette as filling ornament; below, band of billet and squares between bands with trace of superimposed white band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.242)
